attributes.action: Ensure restaurant/food seller menus list any present allergens in their food
attributes.background: In many restaurants it is difficult to know if an allergen is present in the food being served. Allergy sufferers should be able to see what is going into their food, as they can on supermarket packaging. A menu with a full list of ingredients should therefore be available if required.

attributes.action: Ban political nominations for the Queens honours list
attributes.background: The curry system has been brought into disrepute by David Cameron.

attributes.action: Reduce university fees from £9000 a year to £1500 a year.
attributes.background: With fees being so high and possibly continuing to rise, the amount of students who are unable to afford further education is increasing, and any student who continues with further education will leave with at least £30,000 worth of debt, which they have to pay back with interest, which is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Students have to pay university fees and living fees for the entirety of their stay at university which can range from three to seven years, possibly more. It is almost financially impossible for the average household to support this, even worse for lower income households. With the amount of students who attend university increasing (2015 recorded 532,300 students) paying £2000 each, per year should be more than enough to support universities, whilst being financially possible for students.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of retirement honours and dissolution honours.
attributes.background: Using these honours to reward friends and party backers brings the whole honours system into disrepute.

attributes.action: Stronger convictions on burglaries
attributes.background: Too many criminals get away with burglary and many continue to reoffend. Preventing burglary is not enough, we need tougher sentences to reduce the amount of offences.
attributes.additional_details: The worst crime against working people is what we have earned and worked hard for is taken away from us.

attributes.action: Make a UK-wide ban on the use of artifical colourings in medication.
attributes.background:
Artifical colouring agents are often unnecessarily used in medication to effect a particular appearance rather than for any significant gain or change in the effectiveness of medications. 
As one of many people prone to allergic reactions to colourings E102-E133 I request a ban from medication use.
attributes.additional_details:
Artifical colourings can make it greatly difficult for those sensetive to find even basic medication without adverse effects.  Examples of which are calcium supplements containing brilliant blue E133 and antibiotics such as amoxicillin containing sunset yellow E110

Reactions in those allergic can range from migraines and photosensitivity,  hypersensitivity,  vomiting & in my personal experience with E133 rash,  nausea, swelling of throat and disorientation. These are unacceptable & unnecessary

attributes.action: Drivers over 60 to take a mini driving test
attributes.background: Drivers over the age of 60 to take a mini test, due to them having slow reaction times .
attributes.additional_details: As we age, we slow down. I think that drivers over the age of 60 should have to take a mini test. There are way to many old drivers causing accidents due to due care and attention.A mini test every five years would lesson the amount of accidents caused by people over 60.

attributes.action: Employers should pay for staff to get home safe if they work past midnight
attributes.background: Employers should be held responsible for making sure their staff get home safe when working late shifts, especially young staff working in city centres. Hospitality staff in particular work late hours in at risk areas  & shouldn't be put in positions which make them vulnerable to attack.
attributes.additional_details: Working in hospitality for the last 6 years I've seen people been put at risk on their way home from work. Due to the nature of the job, working hours and the social climate within our city centres walking home alone can be threatening and potentially dangerous . Employers should value and take a degree of responsibility for the fact that their employees are looked after at all times - this shouldn't end at the door of work.

attributes.action: Abolish the Early Years Teacher Status
attributes.background: The Early Years Teacher Status was introduced in an attempt to provide children in the Early Years with specialist practitioners. These specialists would be responsible for providing high-quality early education, something many lower qualified practitioners already do on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst the EYTS qualifies a practitioner as an Early Years teacher, it does not align itself to QTS and the pay of a teacher with QTS. Therefore, many holders of EYTS are paid substianirslly less than teachers and their are very limited opportunities. Many schools will opt for a holder of QTS than EYTS. In addition, due to, a lack of clarity many nurseries are unsure of the role, the qualification and the rate of pay meaning some Early Years Teschers are paid minimum wage.

attributes.action: Remove the engine size limit on A1 motorcycle license
attributes.background:
Currently the A1 license has three limitations
* maximum 11 kW
* power-to-weight ratio not more than .1 kW
* must not be more than 125 cc
Whereas the A2 license only has two
Some motorscooters/motorcycles may have over 125cc yet still produce under 11 kW yet adhere to the power limit set by A1
attributes.additional_details:
For example, these currently sold vehicles:

Piaggio Vespa PX150
LML Star 151
LML Star 200 

adhere to the power-to-weight ratio and kW limitations of the A1 license.  Changing the A1 criteria to remove the engine size limit brings it in-line with the A2 license (which is also without engine size limit) and gives a further incentive to pass the A1 test rather than ride on a L-plate under a CBT thus improving road safety

attributes.action: Change the law, to give people in rural village communities the right to buy.
attributes.background: I’m living in a housing association home in a village I grew up in.The Housing (Right to Acquire or Enfranchise)(Designated Rural Areas in the Southwest) Order 1997  stops selling of right to buy properties in villages/towns with populations of less than 3000 residents it is unfair  on rural tenants
attributes.additional_details: My application to have the right to aquire/buy in January 2016 was rejected. I’ve written to and been ignored by my local MP for support and received an unsatisfactory reply from Brandon Lewis, Housing Minister at the time (Even though he agrees to the sale of housing association homes). My only recourse is this petition to get the issue raised in parliament and hopefully remove the 3000 resident  stipulation as the housing and planning bill including, right to buy is currently being considered

attributes.action: Ban and prevent the sale of Microtransactions and DlC in games and apps.
attributes.background: Corporations within the gaming , mobile and software industry have become to big and greedy. Exploiting consumers for all of their money and making 100% profit from Microtransactions. Often making money off non existent things such as virtual currency. Also protecting people who have massive bills.
attributes.additional_details:
http://venturebeat.com/2014/02/21/report-finds-free-to-play-microtransactions-make-up-79-of-u-s-app-store-revenues/ 

http://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/phones/2013/02/kids-spent-3200-iphone-avoid-app-charge-hell 

http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2016-03-02-eas-ultimate-team-earning-around-usd650-million-a-year 

http://uk.businessinsider.com/microtransactions-are-ruining-video-games-2015-4

attributes.action: Review British army prior Laser Eye surgery policy
attributes.background: Currently you cant have laser eye before joining the British army prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards. As laser eye surgery makes you eyesight better why should the minimum standards before the surgery stop you. Why stop people getting Laser Eye surgery so there can serve their country
attributes.additional_details: "Spectacle or contact lens corrections must not be greater then -6 dioptres or +6 dioptres in any meridian." - Army Jobs "Laser Eye surgery or anything alike would not enable you to join as your prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards." - Army Jobs.

attributes.action: Stop the banks from creating money from commecial debt, ending boom and bust.
attributes.background: The creation of commecial money from the inflationary act of creating money from debt is responsible for the boom and bust cycles. We need to end the fractional reserve banking where banks are allowed to lend money that they do not have, gaining purchasing power and interest from money they created.
attributes.additional_details:
http://positivemoney.org/videos/97-owned-monetary-reform-documentary/

http://www.investopedia.com/terms/f/fractionalreservebanking.asp

http://positivemoney.org/2011/09/fractional-reserve-banking-leads-booms-busts/

attributes.action: Put metal detectors in all schools in England make our schools safer
attributes.background: Too many young kids and teachers are being attacked while they are in school where they are suppose to be getting a education. No mother,father or guardian wants to be at home or work and get the news that something has happen to there loved one at school.

attributes.action: Bar anyone who's used racist epithets/insulted foreign dignitaries from Cabinet.
attributes.background: A Minister of the Crown must be a fit and proper person, and Parliament should have the power to reject the appointment to Cabinet of someone who has used racist language or whose presence in government would impair Britain's diplomatic relations due to their having insulted foreign dignitaries.

attributes.action: Set up  a legally binding code of conduct/ethics for insurance companies.
attributes.background: Currently it is completely legal for insurers to deliberately use delaying tactics when dealing with no fault insurance claims.  Make it illegal to delay claims by constantly changing case handlers, refusing to acknowledge communication and simply stalling just  to name a few.

attributes.action: Unite all 43 police forces in England and Wales into one National Police Force.
attributes.background: A lot of money can be saved by the ilmination of duplication and as far as the British public is concerned, apart from the accent the North Yorkshire force is the same as the Met.

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Digital Judgement’ as a CORE topic in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Some outcomes of the internet boom are calls to fight, extremism terrorism and hatred and hoaxes, via new social media propaganda.  These threaten our society and children. It MUST be a priority now to arm our children with 'Digital Judgement'; the skill to cope with the threat of the digital world.
attributes.additional_details: Society is easily seduced by online propaganda, drawn towards anti-social intolerant attitudes and behaviours towards the extremes making governance virtually impossible and increasing risks and costs to individuals and communities.  Being able to recognise and resist internet threats is a crucial skill, but getting increasingly harder. We MUST start NOW educating our children to become ‘critical' users of the social media they will grow up with, and which will shape our society for evermore.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Allow all British Overseas Territories Citizens become full British/UK citizens
attributes.background: I am from Turks and Caicos Islands, a British overseas territory located in the Caribbean. British Overseas Territories Act 2002 did not allow  all British Overseas Territories Citizens to become full British citizen. I would like all members of parliament to review and vote on this.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament  should amend the British Nationality Act 1981 and the British Overseas Act 2002 to allow all British overseas territories become full British/UK citizens.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: Make retesting of all road users compulsory every 5 years to ensure road safety.
attributes.background: With road deaths increased in 2014 by 4% from 2013 to 1775, serious road injuries increasing by 5% in 2014 from 2013 to 22807 and the total of 194,477 casualties of all severities in reported road traffic accidents during 2014 retesting of road users is essential to protecting the roads.
attributes.additional_details: http://tinyurl.com/nkzmbzh shows the evidence. What is proposed is that road users be charged for the retest. If they pass the test they are refunded the entire test fee as they are competent, if they fail they revert to a provisional licence and have to retrain similar to learners. This makes roads safer (priority), increases employment within the DVSA (better for workforce), provides additional income source which can be put on improving the road network in the UK. Winners all round.

attributes.action: Repeal the VED legislation Changes coming into force in April 2017
attributes.background: The proposed VED changes coming into force in April 2017 mean it is no longer an incentive to buy a low polluting car.
attributes.additional_details:
The new changes introduce the same basic charge on each subsequent year of ownership after the first year of ownership meaning if someone bought a 1 year old high polluting car they would pay the same tax as a 1 year old low polluting car removing the incentive to buy the economical car.

A much fairer system would be to move all of the band thresholds down so the emissions target for £0 VED is now 80g/km for example. And the 100g/km band now pays £30 a year and so on.

attributes.action: We demand a referendum for any US-UK trade deal
attributes.background: The deal being stitched up by Present-elect Trump and the UK government could have wide consequences for our public services and the status of the UK with our European neighbours. The effect on the NHS, our education system and a range of public services could be catastrophic for ordinary people.

attributes.action: People convicted of Drink driving should be disqualified for life.
attributes.background: Too many people previously convicted return to the road to commit the same offence putting other road users and pedestrians lives at risk.

attributes.action: Allow those 18+ with ID to buy alcohol with someone under 18 present.
attributes.background: I went shopping for Christmas with a friend, wanted to buy a bottle of Baileys for the father in law, I'm 18 and my friend is 17, they would not let me have it because she did not have ID. If you're 18 you should get served. Under 18s will find a way to get alcohol no matter what anyway.
attributes.additional_details: Also, many mothers have been declined to buy alcohol for themselves because they're with their children who are not 18. Are mothers expected to abandon their children now so they can buy a bottle of wine? No.

attributes.action: Include HGV training to the Government backed 24+ Advanced Learning Loans.
attributes.background: To expand the 24+ advanced learning government backed loan to cover HGV license acquisition. There is currently a shortage of 45-50,000 drivers in the UK. Other industries are benefiting from the loan but not an industry that can create 50,000 jobs & whereby the loan could be paid back quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Driver shortage- http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/lorry-driver-shortage-christmas-deliveries-road-haulage-association

Courses covered: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/advanced-learner-loans-qualifications-catalogue

Ave pay for Class 1 (HGV 1) Driver £28,362 PA 
http://www.totaljobs.com/salary-checker/average-class-1-driver-salary

attributes.action: Make every individual who claims job seekers take a drug test before claiming.
attributes.background: This is to stop individuals who claim job seekers claiming whilst containing illegal drugs in their systems. Every job seekers claimant should be free from illegal drugs and it should be a legal requirement to prove this before given their money.

attributes.action: Have an honest open debate about the NHS, social care, future funding & needs.
attributes.background: All political parties disguise the truth facing the people of Britain; the NHS and social care is woefully underfunded and perhaps badly or structurally managed. In any event it does not meet our current or future needs and this is not just a problem for now it is a problem for many years to come.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many links where supporting "evidence" can be found and doubtless the government will point to contrary "evidence." But that misses the spirit of this petition - forget the politics let the people decide decide what we need and then how best to fund it. Nothing should be ruled out or in.

https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

https://fullfact.org/health/uk-health-spending-compared-france-and-germany/

attributes.action: Make London into a free WiFi city.
attributes.background: The government should implement free WiFi in London. This would give access to people who ordinarily would not be able to afford it. It would also encourage businesses and citizens to move to London. It has been tested in many cities around the world with great success.

attributes.action: Make the Government cut V.A.T on "ethical" products.
attributes.background: We the undersigned are demanding that the government promise that once we have left the EU and have control over a V.A.T, products which can be considered "ethical" shall have a V.A.T cut in order to make them more affordable for people and families in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
They could be products which:

- in their production cause no harm to the environments they are produced in, 
- no harm is caused to any animals which are part of the products production, 
- all parties who help create the product are paid a fair and decent amount in return for their work.

Examples of products like these would be free-range eggs or FairTrade products.
With this, the general public will be more inclined to buy these, as they will be more affordable.

attributes.action: Remove the powers local authorities have to switch off street lights at  night.
attributes.background: Several authorities have switched off street lights at night, regardless of possible crime and safety consequences. The latest is Surrey County Council, to save £210,000 a year, a mere pittance in relative terms, and an amount that could surely be saved by, for example, axing the Chief Exec post.

attributes.action: Ban deer hunting
attributes.background: Hunting is cruel and unnecessary it causes pain and suffering many deer endure prolonged and painful death when they are injured but not killed by hunters This violent form of "entertainment" leaves countless orphaned or badly injured when hunters miss their target quick kills are rare
attributes.additional_details: A British study of deer hunting found that 11 percent of deer killed by hunters die only after being shot two or more times and that some wounded deer suffer for more than 15 minutes before dying

attributes.action: Remove political parties from UK Government Procedures
attributes.background: The people of the UK call upon the current UK Government to offer to form a cross-party coalition Government, and then to change the law to require all MPs to resign from their respective political parties. The Government should then set up regional groups of independent MPs to replace the parties.
attributes.additional_details: With no political parties, UK decisions would be made on the basis of geographical consensus, with MPs working in perhaps 12 Regional Groups at Westminster and taking their individual policy mandate from their own local councillors within their individual Constituency.

attributes.action: Lower the legal drinking age to 17
attributes.background: Lowering the legal drinking age could reduce & tackle the problem of binge drinking in the UK - as well as help young people socially as young school leavers can find it difficult to find friends of a similar age in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: There are multiple reasons for this action to be taken. One reason being that lowering the legal drinking age could prevent people binge drinking when they finally reach 18 years, for example, like a child who's only been allowed fruit & vegetables being let loose at a party full of sweets. In other countries such as France, Germany & Belgium, the legal drinking age is 16 - although a restriction is kept on spirits until 18. I feel that the UK should be keeping up with other countries.

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: Allow NHS staff of 15+ years to retire early. At the age of 55.
attributes.background: Allow NHS staff who have worked for the service for 15+ years to retire early with a full pension at the age of 55. This is for their dedication to to the service and time that they have missed with family members over the years whilst caring for others family members.

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Clocks should be advanced one hour forward in winter instead of summer.
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST) has been implemented since early 1900s. However, there is little benefit that can be gained. If instead of BST, we turn the clocks one hour forward in winter, we can benefit a lot from it. Particularly in those months when we need daylight i.e. October - February
attributes.additional_details:
An introduction of British Winter Time (BWT) as an alternative to BST would be helpful in winter such that: 

1. Decent daylight would be around 07:00 which is usually the time people are leaving for work. 
2. Sunset will be at approximately 16:30 instead of 15:30 nowadays. We can have more of daylight. 

We already have too much daylight in summer and sunset during summer is at a time when people are going to sleep. Decreasing one hour from both sunrise and sunset wouldn't make much difference.

attributes.action: Ban cyclist strobe lights and flashing lights.
attributes.background: We all know the lights, the ones that blind you and flash at you and distract you whilst driving. A dimmer, non-flashing light would be much safer, the amount of people I have seen driving get distracted by those lights are ridiculous!

attributes.action: charge UKentrants £10 a week insurance to cover possible use of our NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a lot of money is lost from free treatment and chasing for payment for treatment with a set duty of £10 a week Im sure the NHS would be a lot better off

attributes.action: Cancel the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: The government is introducing the Sugar Tax a.k.a the Soft Drinks Industry Levy in 2018 and this means that soft drinks will either lose some of their good taste due to lower sugar levels or become more expensive as a result of the drink companies passing on the cost of the tax to their customers.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that this tax is an assault on freedom of choice and another example of a nanny state and I call upon the government and parliament to stop its implementation.

attributes.action: Ban disturbing photo's on new tobacco packaging
attributes.background:
Ban disturbing photos on new tobacco packaging

New tobacco packaging law became introduced to the UK in May 2016 which concluded that blank packaging would be made for all tobacco products. New photographic images are also in place with new packaging which are incredibly disturbing to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One packaging strikes myself which is incredibly appalling to be advertised is the packaging 'Smoking kills your unborn child' with a shocking image of a baby coffin with grieving parents looking over the cot. This image is absurd to anyone who may be going through miscarriage/loss child who DO NOT even smoke. 

Ban these shocking images, blank packaging is reasonable without going over the top.

attributes.action: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1%
attributes.background: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1% to be used exclusively for the NHS & Social Care. With the NHS and Social Care in turmoil both facing unprecedented funding shortages, it is time for the UK workforce to help further fund these services.
attributes.additional_details: Polling has shown that 48% would support a 1% increase in national insurance contributions to go towards the NHS and Social Care.

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!

attributes.action: we need to follow the example of other countries and burn landfill for energy
attributes.background: Landfill is taking over a lot of land in the UK. We should follow by example and burn our rubbish for recycled energy

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Ban schools from giving out detention!
attributes.background:
Children are feeling more depressed and upset after having detention. What gives schools the right to keep our children behind after school. It teaches them absolutely nothing!.
This is going against our human rights. Holding us in a place of solitude and opression!
attributes.additional_details:
My child has never been given a detention before and she is very shy and scared of most things. she gets upset over little things. Last night she was given detention and came home really upset. she is now refusing to go school.
My friends son also was given a detention for 'coughing too many time' as the teacher thought he was messing around. however he just had a cold. he now never speaks to that teacher ever and hates her

attributes.action: Forbid the use of CCTV by local councils for parking enforcement purposes
attributes.background: I am writing this as my local council is using a CCTV camera on a regular basis for the purpose of parking enforcement. The guidelines state this method should be used only "where other means of enforcement are not practical" - but nothing is more practical that a cheap and covert CCTV camera.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from section 1.13 of Surveillance Camera Code of Practice, June 2013, Home office:

"Motorists may regard enforcement by cameras as over-zealous and relevant authorities should use them sparingly. Such systems should , therefore, only be deployed where other means of enforcement are not practical and their effectiveness in achieving this purpose is subject to regular review."
